abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the China - Yangzhou
            Thermal Power Project were as follows: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was highly likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was highly likely. The lessons learned indicated that a
            gradual, realistic approach to major structural change in
            the power sector towards greater market orientation tailored
            to country condition and incentives, can be very effective
            in creating a solid foundation from which to launch
            accelerated reforms. A clear, long-term vision for the power
            sector combined with a baseline of achievable actions and
            strategic flexibility in supervision can allow the project
            to advance sector reform when the opportunity arises.
            Resettlement involving a change in lifestyle requires a
            higher participatory effort in impact and compensation
            assessment. Initially there was an underestimation of
            compensation for populations resettled from rural areas to
            the town center. The approach of combining policy dialogue
            at the Central Government level with the testing of the
            policy through operations in selected provincial power
            companies was a key element in successful project outcome.
            Given the enormous size of the country-with several tiers of
            government and varying issues among the
            regions/provinces-the pilot testing of reform ideas on model
            projects before moving to broad applicability, has been a
            prudent and successful approach. A high sense of
            environmental awareness and ownership by implementing
            agencies and concerned authorities and detailed
            Environmental Management Plan are required to produce highly
            satisfactory environmental results. The introduction of
            international competitive bidding and multiple suppliers
            along with substantial local contracting can reduce costs
            but requires close interfacing of engineering design parameters.
